titleInfo.title: Major Operating Room at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Inked on negative: ''Mile High Photo, 20135.'' Handwritten on envelope: ''#452 JCRS Misc. Medical Facilities.'' On back of photograph: ''#452 JCRS Major operating room for collapsing lungs.''

mods.abstract: Interior of the major operating room used for collapsed lungs on the campus of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
